description:
Kakeru Miwa is an otherwise ordinary high school student, but a strange twist puts him on the front line in a supernatural battle against the menacing Oni. With the help of a fantastically powerful battle suit known as “Yoroi”, Kakeru joins an elite team that fights the monstrous Oni and defends humanity from otherworldly threats. The team is assigned to protect Oka Myojin, a shrine maiden who is prophesized to save the world, but she must perform a sacred ritual within Shikizakura, the horizon that connects the spiritual and physical world that lies somewhere amid the blooming cherry blossoms and the colorful autumn leaves. But in this world, the journey to destiny is hard-fought, winding and sometimes deadly.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
hashtag: #シキザクラ #shikizakura #ナゴヤアニメ #ナゴヤセイユウ

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: VTuber
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is either an actual or fictive VTuber.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_nagakawa)

**Date of Birth:** 1974

Naruki Nakagawa is a japanese screenwriter and manga author.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uirozamurai) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/uirozamurai)

Manabu Nakatake is a character designer, animator, animation director and prop designer affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/Yostar-Pictures). He was previously affiliated with [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/Tatsunoko-Production).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/g_kurosaki1218) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/go.kurosaki.7)__

__Birthplace:__ Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

__Gou Kurosaki__ is a Japanese CG animator, director and artist affiliated with CG studio Sublimation.

__[Website](http://asaka1007.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakaofficial)__

__Birthplace:__ Aichi Prefecture, Japan
__Hobbies & Special Skills:__ Watching Anime, Karaoke, Cosplay, Sleeping, English

__Asaka__ is a Japanese vocalist and translator.
Techno band composed of [Takumi Saitou](https://anilist.co/staff/128218) and Yutaka "YONENAGA" Yonenaga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jb_yst)

Yuu Satou is a CG animator and director at Sublimation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.
Producer and VP of business and legal affairs with formerly ADV and now Sentai Filmworks.

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
